item.title: Muddy Times
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Tough Mudder makes it into the news again, this time they were written up in the NYTimes.

The post Muddy Times appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Tough Mudder makes it into the news again, this time they were written up in the NYTimes.

The article gives some good information about Will & Guy, the duo behind the project — No mention of the unsung heroes here at mimoYmima who created their visual identity and made their web presence possible, but that’s okay, we’re holding out for our own Times article.

The post Muddy Times appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Tough Mudder Sells Out Their First Event
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We are proud to announce that last week the first ToughMudder event sold out. They capped admission at 4500 mudders to ensure safety and a smooth first event. (It's good to know someone is looking out for your safety when you're jumping 15 feet into a pit of mud.)

The post Tough Mudder Sells Out Their First Event appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
One of the big successes of this year for us was the Tough Mudder website. We are proud to announce that last week the first event sold out, they capped admission at 4500 mudders to ensure safety and a smooth first event. (It’s good to know someone is looking out for your safety when you’re jumping 15 feet into a pit of mud!)

Congratulations to the Mudders from everyone at mimoYmima, we look forward to helping with the future events!

The post Tough Mudder Sells Out Their First Event appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Launch: ToughMudder.com
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We've made websites for all kinds of businesses, but this is the first project we've worked on that involved mud, fire, barbed wire, AND mankinis. Tough Mudder is the toughest one day endurance race on the planet, so their site needed to kick some major ass.

The post Launch: ToughMudder.com appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We’ve made websites for all kinds of businesses, but this is the first project we’ve worked on that involved mud, fire, barbed wire, AND mankinis. Tough Mudder is the toughest one day endurance race on the planet, so their site needed to kick some major ass.

The site was designed to be expandable, as they will be having more races in the future and incorporating new content down the road. If you think you’re tough enough, or if you just want to see how awesome the site is, go to ToughMudder.com

The post Launch: ToughMudder.com appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Tough Mudder Logo
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We're just starting work on ToughMudder.com, which is sure to be one of the most unique and high energy projects we work on in the coming year (maybe ever).

The post Tough Mudder Logo appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We’re just starting work on ToughMudder.com, which is sure to be one of the most unique and high energy projects we work on in the coming year (maybe ever). It looks like an endurance race for someone with a death wish:

grunge fonts

The first thing we’re going to do is choose a kick ass logo font. After looking through a few hundred grunge fonts we came up with these as the finalists:

NOTE: You can click any of the images in this page for more detail and options

Narrowed down fonts & logo choices

Need to amp it up more, enter flames and mud

I think we have a winner

We met again with the Tough Mudder blokes today, worked through some of the logos and narrowed it down to one:

The post Tough Mudder Logo appeared first on mimoYmima.
